sentence.text: We describe a previously unreported syndrome characterized by secondary (post-natal) microcephaly with fronto-temporal negative regulation of protein kinase activity hypoplasia, multiple pituitary hormone deficiency, seizures, severe visual impairment and abnormalities of the kidneys and urinary tract in a highly consanguineous family with six affected children.

entity.text: negative regulation of protein kinase activity

sentence.text: We also show expression of response to hypoxia within the central nervous system, including the hypothalamus, as well as the renal tract during human embryonic development.

The progressive neurological abnormalities, congenital hypopituitarism and post-retinal visual pathway dysfunction in affected individuals demonstrates for the first time the essential role of response to hypoxia in the development of the hypothalamo-pituitary axis, post-natal brain growth, and visual and renal function in humans.
